means: 尝，品尝，尝到( taste的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: One way of persuading people to drink sensibly is to provide good - tasting alternatives with less alcohol.
sentence.Network_cn: 劝人适量饮酒的一个方法就是提供口感好但酒精含量低的酒.

sentence.Network_en: Many people add salt to their food out of habit, without even tasting it first.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多人是出于习惯往食物里加盐，事先甚至连尝都不尝。

sentence.Network_en: A spicy , sharp - tasting radish was exactly what her stomach craved.
sentence.Network_cn: 她正馋着想吃一个香甜可口的红萝卜呢.

list.abs: 品味(taste)的原始定义：「嘴巴中特定器官兴奋的感觉。」，与嘴巴的味觉有关，而品味(taste)在17th、18所以可以看出，美食与建筑 …

entry.def: Tasting is used in expressions such as wine tasting to refer to a social event at which people try different kinds of the specified drink or food in small amounts.

means.word_mean: 1. a small amount (especially of food or wine)
2. a kind of sensing; distinguishing substances by means of the taste buds;
3. taking a small amount into the mouth to test its quality;

sentences.sentence: "cooking was fine but it was the savoring that he enjoyed most"

auth_sentence.content: They swallow the rest of it without tasting it.

auth_sentence.content: It was still strong-tasting, but less mystically sweet.
